method.name: getDeviceList
method.tp:docstring: Returns a list of the detected v4l2 devices

method.name: getCapabilities
method.tp:docstring: Returns a map of map of array of strings, containing the capabilities (channel, size, rate) of a device

method.name: getSettings
method.tp:docstring: Returns a map of settings for the given device name

method.name: applySettings
method.tp:docstring: Set the preferred settings for a given device name

method.name: startLocalRecorder
method.tp:docstring: Starts a local recorder. Video and/or audio are recorded from preferred devices.

arg.name: filepath
arg.tp:docstring: Base file path for local recording. This is not the final path as the file extension will be added (final path can be obtained as return value of this method).

arg.name: finalPath
arg.tp:docstring: Output path of newly started local recording. This file path also serves as recording identifier for stopLocalRecorder.

arg.name: filepath
arg.tp:docstring: Identifier for local recorder to be stopped (obtained as return value of startLocalRecorder).

method.name: startCamera
method.tp:docstring: Starts the video camera, which renders the active v4l2 device's video to shared memory. Useful for testing/debugging camera settings

method.name: startAudioDevice
method.tp:docstring: Starts the audio layer stream, so the audio device can be read.

arg.name: resource
arg.tp:docstring:
A media resource locator (MRL). Currently, the following are supported:
camera://DEVICE
display://DISPLAY_NAME[ WIDTHxHEIGHT]
file://IMAGE_PATH

arg.name: switched
arg.tp:docstring: Returns true if the input stream was successfully changed, false otherwise

arg.name: started
arg.tp:docstring: Returns true if the camera has already started, false otherwise

arg.name: state
arg.tp:docstring: Returns true if hardware decoding is enabled, false otherwise

arg.name: state
arg.tp:docstring: Toggle hardware decoding

arg.name: state
arg.tp:docstring: Returns true if hardware encoding is enabled, false otherwise

arg.name: state
arg.tp:docstring: Toggle hardware encoding

arg.name: name
arg.tp:docstring: Device name

arg.name: angle
arg.tp:docstring: Angle of device in degrees (counterclockwise)

method.name: getRenderer
method.tp:docstring: Returns a map of information about a call's renderer.

arg.name: callId
arg.tp:docstring: Call ID to get info about.

arg.name: map
arg.tp:docstring: Map containing renderer info, with empty strings and "0" if not found.

signal.name: deviceEvent
signal.tp:docstring: Signal triggered by changes in the detected v4l2 devices, e.g. a camera being unplugged.

signal.name: startedDecoding
signal.tp:docstring: Signal triggered when video is available in a shared memory buffer.

arg.name: id
arg.tp:docstring: The ID of the call associated with the video, or "local" in the case of local video

arg.name: shmPath
arg.tp:docstring: The path of the newly created shared memory

arg.name: width
arg.tp:docstring: The width of the video in the shared memory

arg.name: height
arg.tp:docstring: The height of the video in the shared memory

arg.name: isMixer
arg.tp:docstring: Whether or not this texture belongs to a video mixer or is a single texture

signal.name: stoppedDecoding
signal.tp:docstring: Signal triggered when video is no longer available in a shared memory buffer.

arg.name: id
arg.tp:docstring: The ID of the call associated with the video, or "local" in the case of local video

arg.name: shmPath
arg.tp:docstring: The path of the newly created shared memory

arg.name: isMixer
arg.tp:docstring: Whether or not this texture belongs to a video mixer or is a single texture
